Pre-Game Insights: The BlackCaps lost their most recent match against Pakistan even though they scored 401 runs.
Kane Williamson struck an incredible 95 runs off 79 deliveries, Rachin Ravindra added another hundred runs.
Fakhar Zaman and Babar Azam had scored 194 runs for the second wicket before the rain interrupted play.
Sri Lanka amassed 279 runs thanks to a brilliant 108 runs by Charith Asalanka.
Shakib Al Hasan and Najmul Hossain Shanto contributed a vital 169 runs for Bangladesh, despite losing two early wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In Bengaluru's last five games, the first innings score has averaged 320 runs.
The side that wins the toss may decide to go straight to bat and establish dominance.
Others: The Kiwis vying to advance to the top four and the Asian side already eliminated, this will be the final group stage match for both sides.
Angelo Mathews was set for an uncommon 'timed out' ejection, while Sadeera Samarawickrama amassed 41 runs before being removed.
Bangladesh easily reached the target of 280 runs with three wickets remaining in 41.1 overs.
The New Zealand vs Sri Lanka match will be played on Thursday, November 09, 2023, at 2:00 PM at the M.Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru.
